decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on using countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a low curve and efficient threats, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while drawing cards and generating card advantage. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Psychic Frog, the deck is able to control the board and win through incremental advantage. The inclusion of powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor further enhances the deck's ability to stay ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and spells to generate an overwhelming advantage and to set up a game-winning combo with Paradoxical Outcome. The deck includes cards that allow for rapid mana generation, card draw, and the ability to recycle artifacts for additional value. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces for a powerful synergy between artifacts and spells, culminating in a game-winning play. The key strategy revolves around leveraging the synergy between various artifacts and spells to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes various efficient spells and card draw options to help find and protect the combo pieces, while also disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The deck aims to set up a winning game state as quickly as possible and then execute the Doomsday combo to secure victory before the opponent has a chance to respond.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. It aims to slow down the opponent's strategy by constantly denying their spells and resources while generating card advantage through card draw and recursion. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Force of Will, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through attrition and careful planning.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive permanents like Null Rod. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Dig Through Time. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful vintage restricted cards like Black Lotus and Time Walk as well as efficient creatures like Psychic Frog to close out the game. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value and recursion for the deck.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and misdirection spells like Gitaxian Probe, while also removing threats with Fatal Push and Psychic Frog. The deck utilizes card advantage with Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to outvalue opponents, as well as recycling resources with Lurrus of the Dream-Den. The inclusion of combo pieces like Black Lotus and Time Walk allow for explosive turns, while land disruption with Wasteland and Strip Mine keep opponents off balance. Overall, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and grind out wins through attrition.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and generating card advantage. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to control the game through a combination of efficient removal, counterspells, and card draw, ultimately out-valuing the opponent and grinding out a win through attrition. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recast low-cost permanents from their graveyard, further enhancing the deck's ability to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebear creatures and disruptive artifacts to slow down the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming them with efficient and powerful creatures. By combining hatebear creatures with artifact acceleration, the deck aims to control the game and punish opponents for playing noncreature spells, ultimately securing victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana through artifacts like Grim Monolith and Mishra's Workshop, using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to draw through the deck and find key combo pieces like Time Vault and The One Ring. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo. Karn, the Great Creator and Coveted Jewel provide additional utility and win conditions, while cards like Voltaic Key and Manifold Key help to untap artifacts for extra mana or combo potential.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Paradoxical Outcome to generate massive card advantage and mana acceleration, enabling explosive combo plays. By combining fast mana artifacts like Mana Crypt, Sol Ring, and Moxen with powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Paradoxical Outcome, the deck aims to quickly assemble a winning board state or combo off for a game-ending play. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for added resilience and value recursion throughout the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive, efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure opponents. It utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Teferi, Time Raveler to assert dominance early on. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and bounce effects, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's strategies while deploying threats like White Orchid Phantom and Quantum Riddler to close out the game quickly. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for spells and creatures, allowing for a fast-paced, proactive game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful artifacts like Moxen, Mana Crypt, and Sol Ring to ramp up mana quickly. The deck also includes key cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the board. The inclusion of artifacts like Time Vault and Mystic Forge allow for powerful combos and card advantage. The deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure through efficient artifact creatures and control elements.

This deck focuses on using powerful control cards and tutors to assemble key combo pieces, while utilizing graveyard recursion and card advantage to outvalue opponents. The inclusion of Gifts Ungiven allows the deck to search for specific cards and set up game-winning combos, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to cast cards from their graveyard. The deck also includes a variety of disruptive spells and counterspells to control the game and protect its game plan, making it a versatile and powerful control deck in the Vintage format.

This deck focuses on using artifacts and combo pieces to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards to eventually win the game through a powerful combo, such as using Paradoxical Outcome to bounce artifacts back to your hand and replay them for more mana and card advantage. The deck also utilizes cards like Tinker to find key pieces like Time Vault and Bolas's Citadel to establish a dominating board presence. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently assembling your combo pieces and outpacing your opponent to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures to slow down the opponent while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It also includes various artifact acceleration cards to support the aggressive strategy. The deck aims to control the game tempo by combining hatebear creatures with disruptive spells to hinder the opponent's game plan. It also incorporates a few powerful enchantments to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy and provide early game acceleration.

This deck focuses on using artifacts and card draw to generate significant value and combo off with Paradoxical Outcome. The goal is to efficiently cycle through your deck, generate mana with zero-cost artifacts, and eventually find the win condition. It also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal to protect the combo and handle threats. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck gains additional resilience and the ability to recur important cards from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to achieve a powerful and efficient win through its combo potential.
